Evidence Statements: The student can illustrate the state of a material, like ice, before it is heated.
The student can show what the material looks like after it has been heated, such as ice turning into water.
The student can depict the material after it has been cooled again, reversing the change, like water turning back into ice.
The student can label their drawings to explain how the changes from heating to cooling are reversible.
The student can provide a brief description or key to indicate whether the change they drew is reversible or not.
